SEARCH
Package com.simcraft.graphics.effects.sprite_effects

Class HitFlashEffect

java.lang.Object
com.simcraft.graphics.effects.TimedVisualEffect
com.simcraft.graphics.effects.sprite_effects.HitFlashEffect
All Implemented Interfaces:
VisualEffect
public class HitFlashEffect extends TimedVisualEffect
A visual effect that applies a brief white flash to an entity's sprite when it is hit. The flash effect brightens the sprite for a short duration and then reverts it to its original appearance.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class com.simcraft.graphics.effects.TimedVisualEffect

    durationMillis, isEffectActive, isEffectFinished, startTime

  • Constructor Details

    • HitFlashEffect

      public HitFlashEffect(Entity entity, long durationMillis)
      Constructs a HitFlashFX for a specific entity with a given flash duration.
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity to apply the flash effect to.
      durationMillis - The duration of the flash effect in milliseconds.

  • Method Details

    • onStartEffect

      protected void onStartEffect()
      Called when the hit flash effect starts. It captures the entity's current sprite and applies the white flash by increasing the RGB values of its pixels.
      Overrides:
      onStartEffect in class TimedVisualEffect

    • updateTimedEffect

      protected void updateTimedEffect(long elapsedTime)
      This method is called during each update cycle of the effect. For a simple hit flash, no continuous updating of the sprite is needed; the change is applied at the start and reverted at the end.
      Specified by:
      updateTimedEffect in class TimedVisualEffect
      Parameters:
      elapsedTime - The time elapsed since the effect started in milliseconds.

    • onEffectEnd

      protected void onEffectEnd()
      Called when the hit flash effect has completed its duration. It reverts the entity's sprite back to its original appearance.
      Specified by:
      onEffectEnd in class TimedVisualEffect

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics2D g2d)
      This method is called when the entity is rendered. The flash effect is applied directly to the entity's current sprite, so this effect doesn't need to draw anything additional.
      Parameters:
      g2d - The Graphics2D context to draw on (not directly used by this effect).
